ratings.question_text: The readings/cases/textbooks used in this course were __________ .
Out-of-class assignments for this course were ___________ to my learning.
The workload for this course in comparison to other courses was ___________.
The pace of this class was ____________ for optimal learning.
Field trips were well designed and ran smoothly.
I learned a lot from field trips.
How clearly does the instructor provide explanations of conceptual material?
How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
comments: Working on a real project in Baltimore was great, the lectures were less so, or really the lectures just became repetitive.
More of an intro to Designed Experiments than Urban Ecology but it was a unique course that I truly enjoyed.

narratives.question_text: What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: Great connection to industry work being done.
Field trip to baltimore, working through the project itself
The Baltimore project was the whole class and it was really fun to work for a client on a team of architects and ecologists to create a vision and plan for baltimore.
Working with the architecture students

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: It felt chaotic at points
Cover the topics of urban ecology more completely, not just the scope of the instructors work.

More time working on project, getting feedback etc. The lectures became repetitive, Alex has a tendency to ramble in the beginning, which eats up working time. There wasn't a great correlation between the lectures and the projects themselves. Would have been great to have started the class with readings/materials about baltimore itself rather than theory of urban ecology. And then use the baltimore readings to discuss how this combination of designer + ecologist could address the problem in a new way.
We wanted to learn more about urban ecology. It seemed too focused on the product of our baltimore projects. We didn't learn enough for an intro course.

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
comments: There is a good blend of the amount of lecture and discussion but the subjects are not always well formulated.

narratives.question_text: Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: This course does not align well with the other system sciences classes at FES like Industrial Ecology. These classes have a lot to learn from each other.
it was a perfect fit
I love urban ecology and plan to take more courses with A. Felson.
I am interested in water quality, stormwater management in coastal cities.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: it's the exact types of projects i want to work on

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: yes
Yes, it was a very specific skill that we gained- Designed Experiments.
Yes.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: advantages - great to work with people from forestry and architecture school at same time disadvantages- as with all class group work, it suffers from a lack of clearly defined roles. When working on real projects, you have a project lead who is ultimately responsible, and then each team member has a specific role.
We had a great team that truly enhanced my love for the course.
I found working with the architecture students on their designs very gratifying.

narratives.question_text: For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: Be patient - urban ecology is very new field, it's ok that the class is a little helter skelter, the field itself is helter skelter. Focus on the group project.
It was a really pleasant, different course! Take it
